alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Fergus County below 4500ft; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Northern Blaine County; Snowy and Judith Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 18 at 1:57AM MST until November 18 at 8:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero through this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing and drifting snow expected with winds gusting as high as 35 to 45 mph this afternoon. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Montana. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 AM MST this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerously cold wind chills this morning could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. Widespread blowing and drifting snow could significantly reduce visibility and create hazardous driving conditions late this morning through early this evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
